I’ve trained hundreds of journalists and students over the years, and I’ve spoken about reporting and data analysis at many conferences, including:

  • John Jay College of Criminal Justice’s social media and local journalism roundtable, 2011
  • NICAR 2012 in St. Louis.
  • IRE 2012 in Boston.
  • NICAR 2013 in Louisville, Ky.
  • Hack Jersey hackathon, 2013
  • SPJ Region 1 conference in New Brunswick, N.J., 2013
  • NICAR 2014 in Baltimore.
  • Innovating the Local News Ecosystem, 2014
  • NJ Open Data Summit, 2014
  • SRCCON 2014 in Philadelphia.
  • Hack Jersey 2.0 hackathon, 2015
  • NICAR 2015 in Atlanta.
  • IRE 2015 in Philadelphia.
  • GIJC 2015 in Lillehammer, Norway.
  • NICAR 2016 in Denver.
  • NICAR 2017 in Jacksonville, Fla.
  • Collaborative Journalism Summit, 2017 in Montclair, N.J.
  • NICAR 2018 in Chicago.
  • Criminal Justice Reporting and Public Data symposium at the Brown Institute, 2018.
  • Poynter’s Journalist’s Guide to Covering Jails.
  • NICAR 2019 in Newport Beach, Calif.
  • NICAR 2020 in New Orleans.
  • Diving Into COVID-19 Data on the internet, 2021.
  • NICAR 2021 lightning talks on the internet.
  • NICAR 2023 in Nashville, Tennessee.
  • ACOS Alliance Annual Safety Coordination Meeting 2023 in New York.
  • NICAR 2024 in Baltimore, Maryland.
  • NICAR 2025 in Minneapolis, Minnesota.

In addition, I’ve taught and spoken at…

  • Columbia University’s Graduate School of Journalism, where I teach classes on investigative techniques and an intro to data reporting.
